question: If my stopping time safety limit is set to 200 ms and the robot stopped in 1000ms, what will happen?
gold_answer: The robot arm will enter recovery mode because te safety limits have been violated.

Step-by-step reasoning:
- The question is about the Stopping Time Limit safety function: if the configured limit (200 ms) is exceeded by the actual stop time (1000 ms), what is the system reaction?
- The provided facts explicitly cover:

  - How the safety system reacts to safety limit violations: “Limit Violation → Stop Category 0” and “If the robot detects a fault or violation in the safety system (e.g., … a safety limit is exceeded), then a Stop Category 0 is initiated.”

question: I have just made a modification to the robot arm. Is there any check I need to do afterwards?
gold_answer:
Yes, there is a list of tests to conduct after making a modification to the robot arm. 
Verify all safety inputs and outputs are correctly connected.
Test all connected safety input and output, including devices common to multiple
machines or robots, are functioning as intended.
Test emergency stop buttons and inputs to verify the robot stops and the brakes engage.
Test safeguard inputs to verify the robot motion stops. If safeguard reset is configured,
check that it functions as intended.
Look at the initialization screen, activate the reduced input and verify the screen changes.
Change the operational mode to verify the mode icon changes in top right corner of
PolyScope screen.
Test the 3-position enabling device to verify that pressing to the center on position enables
motion in manual mode at a reduced speed.
If the Emergency Stop outputs are used, press the Emergency Stop push-button and
verify that there is a stop of the whole system.
Test the system connected to Robot Moving output, Robot Not Stopping output, Reduced
Mode output, or Not Reduced Mode output to verify the output changes are detected.
Determine the commissioning requirements of your robot application.
generated_answer:
Yes. After any modification you must perform the commissioning tests listed before using the robot [009__L1__9._Commissioning__pp97-97.pdf].

Do at least:
- Verify all safety inputs and outputs are correctly connected.  
- Test all connected safety inputs/outputs (including devices common to multiple machines/robots).  
- Test Emergency Stop buttons/inputs to verify the robot stops and brakes engage.  
- Test safeguard inputs and (if configured) safeguard reset.  
- Check the initialization screen, activate Reduced mode input and verify the screen changes.  
- Change operational mode and verify the mode icon
judge_doc_relevance:
Step-by-step reasoning:
1) Interpret the question: The user asks what checks are needed after making a modification to the robot arm. Keywords: “after modification,” “checks,” “verify,” “test,” “commissioning.”

2) Scan the provided facts for related content:
- The “9. Commissioning” section explicitly states tests “must be conducted … after making any modifications,” and lists specific checks (verify safety I/O connections, test safety inputs/outputs, E-stops, safeguard inputs, reduced mode input, operational mode icon, 3-position enabling device, Emergency Stop outputs, and safety-related status outputs).
- The “15. Maintenance and Repair – Safety for Maintenance” section says “After maintenance and repair work, checks must be done to ensure the required safety level” and to test the correct functioning of all safety functions.
- “15.1. Testing Stopping Performance” discusses periodic testing of stopping performance, directly relevant to post-maintenance/commissioning validation.
- Several safety configuration and mode sections (10.2, 10.3, 10.3.x, 10.4.x) describe safety functions, planes, limits, and outputs that are the kinds of items you verify during post-modification checks.

3) Conclusion: The facts include multiple passages directly addressing checks required after modifications, including concrete test steps. Even though many other sections are broader (programming, payload, I/O), criterion (2) says any related content makes the facts relevant.
